website_summaries.verdict: Small head and jaw allow you to work successfully in small spaces. High quality pliers.
pros: No slipping once these pliers lock onto the nut or pipe, thanks to self-locking feature on the jaws
9 different positions for the jaws, giving you complete control over jaw width
cons: May not work well for all types of jobs as a general purpose set of pliers

customer_reviews.title: What a nicely made tool
customer_reviews.text: I work in a harsh environment so the Cobra's are really not an option. These will probably get sprayed down once a month or so with wd-40 to keep them rust free. This tool is extremely easy to open and close I actually prefer it to the push button that force you to change grip position. With some practice I get the feeling these can be open/closed with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Fish

customer_reviews.title: Interesting tool
customer_reviews.text: Although I myself prefer my old worn channel lock brand to any other, I will say these “Nippits” (as there now know at our shop), is a handy lil tool. The guys love it, but comparatively to what job I’m doing, my “locks” still do the best and don’t damage my work. The “Nippits” are amazing for biting ahold of your material your using, but if it’s too soft,,,,,,,,,then you will get teeth marks. Love the adjustable locking mechanisms. Great tool. Will purchase more products from this brand in the future, because I love tools. With that said , I do find myself grabbing for my “locks” in most instances.
customer_reviews.author: Charity

customer_reviews.title: I work as a service plumber and love the Knipex Cobra pliers
customer_reviews.text: I work as a service plumber and love the Knipex Cobra pliers. Almost all of our Techs use Knipex over Channel locks except one. He tried my Cobras for a few days but was not sold on the push button style. He was just used to the channel lock style so I bought him this pair as they are more similar to the channel lock style. He fell in love. He likes the handles feel and lack of pinching and has even admitted a better grip on pipe/fasteners with less hand strain. Needless to say our shop is a full Knipex loving crew again.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Great value, craftsmanship, ease of use.  Overall superior tool
customer_reviews.text: After losing count of the number of channellocks I have broken, and injuring myself the last time, I decided to give these a try based upon the opinions of some fellow electricians. I have never liked the Cobra pliers, mainly because I'm used to how channellocks operate, so the alligators seemed a better fit. After breaking them in after a couple weeks, I am very impressed with their quality and in my opinion better grip and ease of use. They have a smaller profile and fit into tighter areas, grip better and seem to mark conduit less than any other plier I have used. I recommend the alligators to all my coworkers.
customer_reviews.author: jeff schroerlucke

customer_reviews.title: German made awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: There is almost nothing better than a German made tool. You can feel the engineering that went into designing these pliers. They are perfect for most household chores. I use them for pulling broken lag bolts out of wood and reloading die lock rings. I haven’t had a single issue or complaint. These are made in Gemany with German steel. They are also very durable while maintains a lightweight feel. I can honestly put them in a back pocket and forget about them. The teeth are machined well and very sharp. The month is designed for pulling or pushing with a single hand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: If you ever owned a Knipex tool there is no need to say more. Knipex tools are an extreme professional quality tool. Built for the toughest jobs with comfort built in. They are on the pricey side but not. You'll purchase one Knipex tool for every 3 brand name tools. For an example. Purchase one 10" Knipex side cutter and one 10" Cobalt and 1 Klein side cutters. The Knipex will outlast both cutters. Very happy with purchase and will continue to purchase more Knipex.
customer_reviews.author: Blind woodcrafter

customer_reviews.title: This Is The Best Tool I Own, carry every day. Have 2 bigger sizes as well.
customer_reviews.text: Carry these every day, got a leather belt holder;(clc custom leathercraft # 767 fits perfect). Very good for close quarter sink faucets, and toilet tanks/supply lines coz they're small but jaws open wide. Best tool ever for rockering out flooring nails and staples. I got them as gifts for friends who are jobbers and they loved them. Very grippy, and ergonomic w/ padded handles that hold up well under heavy use. Have my first pair >15 yrs. - cannot wear them out. Have all the sizes in my van and threw out all the others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Knipex “channel-lock” pliers have an excellent reputation for a reason. Adjust easily, don’t slip and grip whatever is unfortunate enough to be their target really well. BIG capacity for a small package. I think I’ll use these first instead of vise grips in many cases. Came highly recommended by a friend and I agree. Only have this size....for now but will look to add more when on sale.
customer_reviews.author: M. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Quality! Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have had many brands of pliers before and still do, but I feel these are hands down the very best pliers I have ever had. If someone out there thinks there is a better one, let me know, I would like to try them out. They are light weight, Thinner than others which makes it so i can use them in many more situations than ever before. But even though they are thinner and light weight, The strength is incredible. I have yet to break one.
customer_reviews.author: Hilton V.

customer_reviews.title: absolutely a must
customer_reviews.text: my second pair, they open wider than the previous ones. I'm a commercial plumber, and these are one of the few things that I keep on my person at all times while working. (tape measure and torpedo level being the other two items) and I'm able to do things that these that my co-workers require their bigger channel locks to do
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Farley

customer_reviews.title: Not railroad strong.
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers but use caution when applying force. I'm a RR carmen and had a failure while tightening a 5/8 nut. Amazon issued a refund and I purchased the 12in version. Hopefully these are stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Riding Rails

customer_reviews.title: Great little pliers
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been an electrician for decades and found these Knipex pliers to be the best little channellocks to buy. They’re made of some type of hardened metal, have nicely machined edges that don’t dull, and they open wider than other brands. The only time I buy them now is when I’ve lost a pair. Never had them wear out or break.
customer_reviews.author: mumbojumbo

customer_reviews.title: is one of the best one of the best
customer_reviews.text: Knipex tools are one of the best Note these are alligator and not the push-button cobras they're still good though I got them through a Slickdeals special at a good price again note that these are alligator and not cobras with the push button they're still good though I keep them in my house tool box thank you for reading.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Diodati

customer_reviews.title: Great grip.
customer_reviews.text: I will admit these work better than channel locks for gas pipe. Because of how narrow the head is there is more pressure being applied to a smaller area that helps with the grip. Please do take a little while to get used to locking them into position after using channel locks for 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: krdaniels

customer_reviews.title: The button on the cobra is great, but it's nice to be able to adjust ...
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the alligator style over the cobra. The button on the cobra is great, but it's nice to be able to adjust on the fly without have to use both hands. Both are made with the quality knipex has become known for.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers there is!
customer_reviews.text: his is the best pliers ever made! It's strong, light and easy to use. Best part is the narrow nose. Too many pliers are so wide in the nose that you can't use them in tight places. I lost my favorite like this helping a guy along the highway in Colorado so when I got home I immediately ordered a new one and it's just as good as my old favorite. I seldom go anywhere without it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve E

customer_reviews.title: 10 Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are phenomenal. I now own these as well as the Cobras, the Raptors and the Pliers Wrench (all 10"). You will not be disappointed in Knipex. I know with some tools you just " pay for the name" but that is not the case here. I will probably never buy another brand of pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Will Cooke

customer_reviews.title: This is a 100% professional tool, made in Germany. It is ABSOLUTELY worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is just an awesome tool. Very professional quality, high quality steel and precision casting. It can literally grab a round pipe without squeezing at all. Probably almost impossible to break unless you're doing something really dumb with it. This is a slip-joint style, I like them because they can be adjusted with one hand. If you do not like slip joint, look up the Knipex Cobra pliers, same basic pliers with a push button adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool, you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say at all about these pliers. They’re sturdy, ergonomic and the jaws grip better than most pliers in most applications. As a marine repair tech, these pliers are my go to for 90% or more my plier use. Narrow width on the jaws makes them fit into tight spaces. The angle of the handles and jaws somehow make these grip much tighter than standard channel locks. They’re also lightweight and comfortable to use. They’re a must have for professional mechanics and DIYers who appreciate a quality tool and are willing to pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Knipex Tools Rule
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said thousands of times before about Knipex?!? Nothing, lol. Amazon has only made me happier with Knipex by giving the lowest price I have ever found on genuine Knipex tools, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: BriDog

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers for everyday Auto mechanic work
customer_reviews.text: Pro : Sturdy ,solid grabbing on surfaces ,I should get this earlier because I use to have a cheap craftsman one and was lost,lucky so now I can have a quality tool for my everyday works Con : Not really .
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers ever
customer_reviews.text: You cannot go wrong if knipex is in the name. My husband is never seen without his pliers. These are his go to tool he uses them at work and at home. He has multiple pairs this is the best pair of pliers you will find on the market
customer_reviews.author: Real Honesty

customer_reviews.title: Great small pliers
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Had the 7 1/4” cobras, wanted to see about the alligators. Very compact and lightweight, but very strong. Teeth are sharp and grip is awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Floyd

customer_reviews.title: A tough pair of pliers in a small package !
customer_reviews.text: I been wanting to get a pair of these for awhile and I’m so glad I eventually did order them. The first day of use seemed to break them in nicely, they lock in place a little differently then your traditional channel locks. I’ve had them for a few weekends now and use them on the job all the time for tightening box connectors on emt and clipping bang on pipe clamps. If I ever break them I will be buying the same pair!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Winand

customer_reviews.title: Very grippy
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pocket sized pliers around. Made from the same metal as wolverines claws, these pliers are virtually industructable. I have carried a pair of these in my pocket for years and have never worn them out or broken them. The only reason to replace them is the fact that I lose them. They grip everything perfectly, when I am welding and the tips get hot, the handles stay cool to the touch, everyone should have at least 1 pair of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan hill

customer_reviews.title: There’s better for less
customer_reviews.text: When you spend this much on a tool you expect it to be of good quality The adjustment feature is annoying slips out all the time and the teeth went flat within about 2 weeks of use. The teeth also slip a lot even when they were new
customer_reviews.author: Inlandreef

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: These are nice pliers. A little smaller than what i'm used to, but that is good in certain situations. I would recommend the bigger sizes for anything you really need some torque on.
customer_reviews.author: TEC1970

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers by a huge margin
customer_reviews.text: Insanely hard durable and strong. You have to use them to believe. Used them almost daily for years (10" style with comfort grip) and half the time the only tool I carry.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Not that impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am an Industrial Electrician. I use my slip joints daily. I expected more out of these pliers than my Irwin Brand and Channellock. The Knipex pliers just are not any better or worse. I guess because of the price I expected a noticeable difference in quality and performance, and there is not.
customer_reviews.author: steelmaker

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best slip joint pliers you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm an electrician and have used alligator pliers for close to 7 years daily. This is the best pair. I've went through kliens, channel locks, vice grip, you name it. Nothing compares to this tool. It is the only one I have kept on my person for more than 3 years and that's with using other ones in between.
customer_reviews.author: Artem Bashinskiy

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool. Fits perfectly fine in my veto mct tool bag. Comfortable to hold. Fits nicely over and around pipes. Being used daily in commercial HVAC field.
customer_reviews.author: Andrazy

customer_reviews.title: BEST CHANNEL LOCKS MONEY CAN BUY! 11/5!!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it more stars, I would!! By far the best pair of channel locks you can find, there really is nothing better than a pair of knipex.
customer_reviews.author: Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Superior grip
customer_reviews.text: Great brand. Super grip. Do not heat them up with your torches or you will soften the teeth in the jaws and render them slippery.
customer_reviews.author: Hughbie

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers
customer_reviews.text: Some of my other crew don’t like them, but their pliers suck, so they don’t understand quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Knipex is hard to beat !
customer_reviews.text: These are about the sixth pair of Knipex pliers I have. Excellent fit and finish and tough. Thanks Amazon, quick and thorough.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T.

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pliers. My husband is a farmer and these are his favorite pliers. They don’t stick like most adjustable pliers do.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: great tools
customer_reviews.text: You can't get any better tools than Knipex tools and this is no exception. works well and grips good.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Best pliers I've had and that's out of allot of top brands. I've had their cutters and love them decided to try other products of there's and love them at work. I do all types of maintenance work on campers and RV's along with the trucks pulling them and I love these things especially for the price highly recommend giving a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality
customer_reviews.text: KNIPEX tools are the best, the feel and workability while using them is just better then the others.
customer_reviews.author: Pat B.

customer_reviews.title: Best slipjoint
customer_reviews.text: I nice size for most quick small projects where you need to grab ahold of something and need a good grip without doing damage. Nice positive joint intervals that don’t take two hands to locate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... to channel locks and haven't found anything that works better than these I use them on a daily basis ...
customer_reviews.text: I only use these channel locks and have used this brand in the past for over 10 years these are all I buy now when it comes to channel locks and haven't found anything that works better than these I use them on a daily basis for work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great pliers
customer_reviews.text: put them to work right away fixing a sink and Faust they did to job well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: jaramillop

customer_reviews.title: High quality steel
customer_reviews.text: I had lost a pair of these pliers on a job site and found other brands of slip joint pliers to be of far less quality, bulky and difficult to adjust at times. (two hands). Whereas these pliers can be adjusted with one hand. Made in Germany of high quality steel. Narrow enough to get into tighter places than most other brands that are bulky. Quite pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: worth the price will last about 2 years with hard use before the teeth get dull
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I like
customer_reviews.text: the best pliers you will ever own at any price. for $20 these are a steal.
customer_reviews.author: rusty

customer_reviews.title: Water pump pliers
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my dad for Father’s Day. Supposed to be the best pair of water pump pliers you can buy.
customer_reviews.author: kevin michael corley

customer_reviews.title: Knipex are the best
customer_reviews.text: Hands down - the best pliers I’ve ever owned! As a tradesman, I often use tools, and my first knipex tool did not disappoint. The teeth don’t give in to any material I’ve worked on. Easily adjustable, and work like a charm. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: high quality
customer_reviews.text: have come to expect high quality from knipex and was not disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: traci

customer_reviews.title: Quality and handy product.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Quality and handy product. Simple and very versatile usage.
customer_reviews.author: tut

customer_reviews.title: THE DURABILITY, AND STRENGTH...
customer_reviews.text: I'am already getting my moneys worth working on my truck with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great for electricians
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tool use daily as an electrician for emt and compression fittings, plus various other tasks. Local 76.
customer_reviews.author: anonymoussquid

customer_reviews.title: Great quality tool
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for . Pay a little more and get this . It’s worth it
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Small enough it won't take too much room in a tool pouch or box. Strong enough it'll make everyone else's big pliers look like they came from a Bob the Builder playset. Love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Effective to use
customer_reviews.text: I use these everyday for applications ranging from gas fitting to tightening Romex fittings for wire, my go too tool for the job, bought another and will keep buying them when I eventually lose one pair down a long dark hole
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Weber

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pliers
customer_reviews.text: Not a professional mechanic, but i use my tools a lot. Most of my pliers are channelock,but have seen some reviews on these in YouTube. Could not be happier with this pair. Strong grip,well made, and thin head. Will be looking for another pair soon.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schwan

customer_reviews.title: Good pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Good for electrical work and light mechanical work. I have not used them for any dirty pipe work though, so I can’t say if they are better than my name brand channel locks. But I love these pliers, seem really sturdy, nice tolerances, doesn’t get jammed changing channels, doesn’t spontaneously switch channels. Good deal
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: GREAT bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: I didnt realize i had purchased these until they arrived. Happy accident
customer_reviews.author: brien

customer_reviews.title: Well made pliers
customer_reviews.text: Pliers are well worth the money. German made, good quality. Would definitely recommend this brand of pliers.
customer_reviews.author: P. Prunty

customer_reviews.title: This tool is a must for workers that need a channel lock with a slim head. It is tough, light, grips very well and allows you to
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool.....slim lines allow you to get into places the typical channel lock cannot. The tool is of good quality. I had a like product that I used for at least 10 years when the small "barrel" that locks in the desired grove fell out. I super glued it back but a year later it fell out and I lost it.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: High quality  tool
customer_reviews.text: These were fantastic 20 years ago but the push button is worth the extra money
customer_reviews.author: Mike porter

customer_reviews.title: They work well , good pliers
customer_reviews.text: These pliers grab and rarely let go. I use them for plumbing and general repairs. They grab better than any other brand. Make sure you order the right size for your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Richard LA

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great pair of adjustable pliers.
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves having her own pair of adjustable pliers. Great for working around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lee Watson

customer_reviews.title: Small , thin and Powerfull to carry in pouch.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Tool. I carry a pouch on me and they are not heavy and do the job perfectly. Small, thin and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Worn out, useless pliers.
customer_reviews.text: The tool was very old. It was worn out and unserviceable. The tool slips because the notches are worn. The seller covered up engravings with a Sharpie. Probably the worst thing I've ever bought online.
customer_reviews.author: JP King

customer_reviews.title: Good Pliers
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers! I prefer these over all of the major brands, Snap-on, Mac, etc. Use them professionally. The teeth do not wear down quickly and the pivot point stays rigid and does not start to create lateral movement.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: used it for the first time to remove a rusted bolt and it broke,
customer_reviews.author: Benjie D.

customer_reviews.title: Not all pliers are the same.
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of Knipex pliers. Not all pliers are created the same. Perfect for electrical, plumbing, hvac and everything else. The head is narrow - perfect for tight fits. Teeth are great at gripping. I got these short ones for the hard to reach areas.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: mini channel locks
customer_reviews.text: Very nice channel locks. No spring loaded button though. Hardy and good to get in tight spots. Fit nicely in back pocket also.

customer_reviews.title: A must-have tool
customer_reviews.text: Works amazing doesn't slip Great Value will last a long time

customer_reviews.title: Meanest pliers I have ever owned! See vid!
customer_reviews.text: These things bite into everything! They are so good at it you can stand on them and they won’t slip on steel! Only pliers I will ever buy again

customer_reviews.title: German made... enough said
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line in every way you can't go wrong when it's German made best I've ever used

customer_reviews.title: A must for your tool bag
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile, strong and lightweight pliers that have awesome grip

customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Now I know what all the hype is about. By far the best pliers on market

customer_reviews.text: Was hoping to replace Channelok model 422 with these, they are a bit sticky to adjust but will probably get easier with usage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Knipex are the best
customer_reviews.text: If you're a woman in trades like I am, this is the set of adjustable pliers for you. The handles are smaller and fit perfectly into a woman's smaller hand. Many of the men I work with use them too. I have been using this brand for 9 years. I will never go back to ChannelLock brand. These are the best.

customer_reviews.text: Awesome pliers I buy all Knipex, I think it is a waste time and money to buy tool of lesser value.

customer_reviews.text: These are great pliers! They aren’t bulky or heavy. They’re pretty light! Jaws aren’t too big which gives you that extra turn on tight spaces. Overall really awesome pliers, can’t go wrong with Knipex!

customer_reviews.title: The plumbers standard.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think it would be worth the investment. But as a union commercial plumber I would recommend these over the Chanel lock brand. They are light, thin and just more user friendly. For sure worth it.

product_meta.title: KNIPEX Tools - Alligator Water Pump Pliers (8801250)
product_meta.description:
Size:10-InchBox joint design provides a stronger joint for increased leverage and a better grip on to the work piece. This 10 inch pliers provides up to 2" working capcity. The handle is engineered with "pinch" free design to protect your hand from those painful blood blisters. Textured coating on the handles allow for a sure, non-slip grip when apply turning torqe to the tool.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Self locking on pipes and nuts with no slipping on the work piece. The optimized jaw shape will grip round, square and hex shape materials. The box joint design is highly stable because of the double guide. The guard on the handle prevents the fingers being pinched as the handles are squeezed together. The 3 piece set will cover pipe capacities from 1-1/4" to 2".
feature_bullets: More output and comfort compared to conventional water pump pliers of the same length: offer 9 adjustment positioning for 30% more gripping capacity
Good access to the workpiece due to slim size in the head and joint area
Self-locking on pipes and nuts: no slipping on the workpiece and low handforce required
Gripping surfaces with special hardened teeth, teeth hardness approx. 61 HRC: low wear and reliable gripping
Box-joint design: high stability because of double guide
